I question if the <u>lenticular nucleus <\u> has any

[<s>and <\s> When we turn to some evolutional 
explanation of <s>corpus callo <\s> why the motor

I think that <s>the <\s> it may be found in the 
fact that they correspond to the fibres connecting 
the proencephalon with the cord in non-callosal 
vertebrates <s>, but where <\s> & where the cerebral cortex 
is merely a rudimentary structure. The brain 
of the fish for instance is a good example 
of this where the fibres form the cord appear to 
be continued directly forwards. In vertebrates,
however, whose cerebral cortex <s>seems to <\s> is highly 
developed, a corpus callosum is always present 
& the meaning of this is, as I take it, that the fibres derived 
from the <s>corpus <\s> new cortical centres decussate 
<s>& enter <\s> in the corpus callosum to become 
attached to a ganglion on the opposite side. 
The corpus callosum <s>of <\s> in fact corresponds 
functionally to the decussation of the pyramids.
